byline.original: By NICHOLAS CONFESSORE and DANNY HAKIM

docs.lead_paragraph: The big-data company Cambridge Analytica says it has the ability to predict the political leanings of every American adult, but how well it works remains unproved.

docs.lead_paragraph: Demand for travel to the United States over the coming months has flattened out following a positive start to the year, with uncertainty over a possible new travel order likely deterring visitors, travel analysis company ForwardKeys said on Monday.

docs.lead_paragraph: The 11 billion pound merger between Standard Life and Aberdeen Asset Management will lead to some job losses but not the 1,000 figure that has been cited in media reports, the Aberdeen CEO said on Monday.

docs.lead_paragraph: Britain's factories are growing at their fastest pace in more than three years, helped by the fall in the value of the pound after the Brexit vote and a recovery in core markets in Europe, a survey showed on Monday.

docs.lead_paragraph: Standard Life has reached agreement to buy Aberdeen Asset Management in an 11 billion-pound merger that should save 200 million pounds a year in costs, pushing rivals to follow suit as fund managers' margins sag.

docs.lead_paragraph: European stocks and U.S. futures fell on Monday, as political tensions, a Deutsche Bank cash call and U.S. President Donald Trump's accusation that his predecessor Barack Obama wiretapped him overshadowed a flurry of M&A activity in Europe.
